msg: These are the Glassbeam Analytics apps available for your organization.

Glassbeam Workbench uses a workbook and sheet file structure, much like Microsoft Excel.

A workbook contains worksheets.

A worksheet contains a single view along with shelves, legends, and the data pane.

Within a workbook, you can create new worksheets, clear an entire worksheet, duplicate worksheets, hide or show a worksheet, and delete a worksheet.

Glassbeam Workbench has several ways to view and organize the worksheets in your workbook.
This option provides information on all the Glassbeam Analytics hosts available for your organization.

A username and password is provided to access Glassbeam Analytics.

Here you can change the default password, access the Administrator Console, know the log parsing status, and log out of the application.

Add tags to the selected datasurces

Select data source and add tag.
Search Data sources or data sources which matches its tag name.
Select all available data sources and add tags to them.

Data source is a custom database view of related attributes of parsed machine data.

Letâ€™s assume a storage device that is made up of physical components like disks, shelves, controller and logical components like RAID group and volume.

Consider a log file generated from this device that has details for each component in it, in a log file.

Once the log data is parsed, the data is stored in the backend in a data store.

Data in this data store can be exposed to the user in the workbench as data sources.

We can create one data source per component as defined in the log file or can create a data source by combining multiple related attributes across different components.
Show list of tags for each dashboard.
Change page size, how much rows per page.
Navigation option to go a specific page.
